newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy FinMin denies insurer tax amid budget plans.
newsitem.headline: Italy FinMin denies insurer tax amid budget plans.

text.p: The Italian Finance Ministry dismissed rumours on the Italian stock exchange that the next budget for 1997 would contain measures imposing a tax on the technical reserves of insurance companies.
"The Finance Ministry categorically denies that measures to tax the technical reserves of insurance companies are under consideration," a Ministry spokesman said.
Insurance company stocks have fallen on the Milan market in recent days on speculation the budget would include such measures.
Italian ministers in the centre-left government start meetings on Tuesday to thrash out the critical 1997 financial package, due to contain 32.4 trillion lire of budget deficit cutting measures.
The package must be presented to parliament by the end of September and approved by parliament by the year end.
